isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1992-1993 - DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: PT Pacer is an electronically-controlled road-speed governing system. System features include:

The PT Pacer system is a full-time electronic governor that receives power from the fuel shut-off solenoid whenever the ignition switch is in the "ON" position. It is available on Cummins L10 and N14, STC engines. STC engines are mechanically controlled engines as opposed to the CELECT electronically controlled L10 and N14 engines.
The PT Pacer system includes a PT Pacer Control Unit (PCU) that is the processing device. The PCU stores the owner specified operation-parameter information in the PCU memory.
The PCU receives input from the tachometer sensor and the speedometer sensor, processes the information, and the PCU generates output signals.
The output signals from the PCU control the Electric Fuel Control valve (EFC), that can limit the amount of fuel to the injectors, limiting road speed.
The PT Pacer utilizes the standard engine harness on the L10 and N14 STC engines. The tachometer and speedometer sensors are also standard on all models.
